strings.Value: "We've known each other for a while. Why haven't you talked about this before?"
"Scouts report back that the maneuver you were asking about is more than possible."
"Please stop. You are my baron and commander, and I am your companion and General. Let things remain as they are."

{n}Varnhold is peaceful and sleepy in the early dawn. It is still a small settlement – not quite yet a town, but striving towards it. It seems to be smiling at you and Baron Varn as the window panes flash in the morning sun. But Maegar seems pensive, almost sad.{/n}

"I'm not sure if it's the right time for this conversation, but I just feel like chatting today. You know, {name}, while we were living like a gang of mercenaries, I tried never to make any plans for the future. Never even imagine a happy and proud picture, 'myself in ten years', who had made all his dreams come true. I considered it bad luck! I'm a little superstitious like that. And it's easier... when you're not thinking about your future... it's not so scary to dash into risky situations."

"But now I have this new title – and Varnhold. Strange how it can change a person. I've started contemplating things I never used to think about before, and ask myself questions I used to never ask. I see my warriors and companions in a new light. And you. I'm boring you, aren't I? Let's consider this a scouting mission. I'm sending out my patrols, trying to figure out if there's a chance that my vis-a-vis might decide to change her disposition towards me. To a... closer one."

"That's a good question." {n}Maegar makes a helpless gesture, as if apologizing.{/n} "Probably because just a year ago we were living from one fight to the next, and the only thing I could offer a woman was a night in my tent and a chance to become a widow before she ever became a wife."
{n}Maegar's eyes grow brighter, and his face relaxes.{/n} "Not a single report has ever made me so happy."
{n}Maegar listens to you with a serious face, than nods abruptly.{/n} "In that case, I apologize. And I promise not to return to this conversation again."
